question: How did anthropologist Leonard J. Frachtenberg use his research to help the people he was studying?

answers.text: He translated works and published them, in close collaboration with the people he studied, to help them better understand their own history.
He taught Native languages at centers on the reservation, contributing to language transmission and preservation.
He collected cultural materials and developed museum dioramas.
He helped the people locate lost, unratified treaties and then use the treaties to successfully sue the federal government.
